summary:
Malta is a small island country in the Mediterranean Sea, near Europe and North Africa. It has been home to many different rulers throughout history, each leaving their mark on the culture. The official languages are Maltese and English. With a population of around 542,000, it is one of the smallest and most crowded countries.

Known for its beautiful architecture and historical sites, Malta attracts tourists and expatriates. It has three UNESCO World Heritage Sites, including ancient temples. The country gained independence in 1964 and is now a member of the European Union. Malta's diverse influences make it a unique place with a rich cultural heritage.
title: Malta
